parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From the same as makrothumos; to be long-spirited, i.e. forbearing or patient.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From a presumed derivative of histemi; to set fast, i.e. to turn resolutely in a certain direction, or to confirm.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
From the present participle of pareimi; a being near, i.e. Advent; physically, aspect.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Trans: I bring near; intrans: I come near, approach. From eggus; to make near, i.e. approach.
